banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: What if the best fertilizer was an algorithm?
videoData.socialTitle: What if the best fertilizer was an algorithm?

nodes.whoTheyAre: Dr. Laxmi Parida is a distinguished research staff member in computational genomics at IBM and a visiting professor at New York University’s Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences. In her work, she applies highly abstract mathematical and computational models to answer urgent human needs, like finding viable food supply chains and personalizing cancer medicine.

videoData.description: Beset by plunging biodiversity, pathogens and skyrocketing populations, our global food supply is at risk — but solutions that rely on chemicals and GMOs come with their own problems. Laxmi Parida proposes an organic solution instead: math.
videoData.socialDescription: Beset by plunging biodiversity, pathogens and skyrocketing populations, our global food supply is at risk — but solutions that rely on chemicals and GMOs come with their own problems. Laxmi Parida proposes an organic solution instead: math.
